text: Probe doesn't seem like a value add, especially over nirkana. It's cute but doesn't get you anything in multi-player.
It doesn't get you nothing.
Telepathy is better than probe in EDH, but this is a mono black deck, unfortunately
It doesn't get enough for a slot.
I tend to agree.
In EDH, it doesn't get you quite enough.
I also hate when folks use things like thoughtsieze and then tell the table. Just a crappy play.
Mm....I mean, politics is politics.
You shouldn't tell the table for nothing, though.
Nope. I'm against it.
I dislike those types of cards in general, though. I'm full of biases if you hadn't noticed Dean.
You? Biased? I never would have put those two words in the same sentence.
I prefer to think of myself as principled. :thinking_face:
I've never seen thought seize in edh but it's one of my least favorite card to play against in modern
I'd have a hard time seeing how one could justify Thoughsieze as a good inclusion even in cuthroat. Way too often you'd just weaken yourself and one other person to the benefit of the other players
I would love seeing one opponent Thoughtsieze another, that's nothing but value for me
gitaxian probe is meh but not bad, it replaces itself and basically makes the deck 98 cards
im going to try it out to see if it helps against a blue deck perhaps
Yah, probe is way different
plus i love the idea of playing it in a mono black deck hehe
there is the novelty factor
Novelty I can get behind.
I like that you can lie about what's in their hand.
"Yeah, sure, don't act like you don't have an answer in hand. I saw that Beast Within."
Or "Wow...you're playing Infect? Didn't see that coming."
Kek
I love probe in mizzix. Gives a free way to start accumulating exp counters
Wouldn't it only give you an xp counter if it's the first one you cast though?
That's typically the point - get down Mizzix and then cast Probe for free, get a point.
For sure. It's obviously best as the first spell to be cast after mizzix, but it's never bad, really. Can trip and get free information is always decent

Weekly Story Recap:
Nissa has more visions. Nissa "re-wires" Kefnet using leylines. Nissa passes the Trial of Knowledge (hence why she's blue)
Oh, and the other three gods got mentioned again. It suggested that they're still ... existing? But changed
Changed into Bolas.
Absorbed by Bolas, that is. Perhaps?
He drank them...
Bigger question, if this sets the precedent that Nissa can mold non-green Leyline energies, what's to stop her from later controlling red, white, etc.

aw I missed thoughtseize convo this morning. It's a great card for combo decks. You target the person most likely to interact with your combos OR combo out slightly faster than you. Jeleva storm decks often play it; mono black Sidisi ANT plays it as part of the interaction package.

With that said, it's niche. You don't play it except in decks that do both of the following: (a) combo out relatively quickly but need a little bit of set-up, and (b) generate lots of mana during the combo turns. So Bx storm, essentially.

The idea of value in stronger metas isn't about accumulating card advantage over time, it's about not losing immediately, or making sure you win faster. Thoughtseize therefore isn't a "1-for-1," it's a "1-for-not-losing" or "1-for-assuring-you-win."
This of course matters a lot less if your deck doesn't have instant win buttons, or if you're not playing against decks with instant win buttons.
Thoughtseizing someone's 5 mana 5/5 doesn't mean anything, but Thoughtseizing away an Ad Nauseam or a Food Chain is a huge deal.

Probe is similar. It's not a huge effect, but probing the guy most likely to interact with your combo is important information. In exchange, if there are no prison effects out you just lose 2 life. No big deal. Probe is probably even WORSE in competitive EDH than casual because prevalent prison effects can make Probe really, really, really bad. Trinisphere for example requires you to pay 2U or 3 and 2 life on a Probe. Terrible deal. So I run GitProbe in all my non-stax blue decks as an auto-include.

The other downside to Probe is that if you draw it off like, an opponent's windfall effect, you don't know what card it's going to replace itself with so you can't know if you'll combo out. It's essentially a free card that gives you information about the opponent's hands but in exchange robs you of information of what your hand will look like. That matters, since a lot of what you'll do not only during your turn but during opponents' turns will depend on whether you have a win in hand or not. You do a play thinking you can't win next turn, but then you probe into a card that would have changed your play. It feels bad man.
that's pretty minor though, but I'd argue still slightly more relevant than the lifeloss in most scenarios. Even in casual I usually lose to big things, not by 2 life.
cool good analysis
sounds like a good blog post
Haha. I want to stick with numbers. :stuck_out_tongue: It's just a big difference between competitive and casual. Thoughtseize IS a bad card, if your meta doesn't have instant win buttons.
It's decent if it does.
I see most spot removal I play as “1-for-not-losing”. Chaos Warp, Krosan Grip
Yeah, that's essentially how competitive works. That's why a competitive DD Zur list has like, mostly counterspells and combo and that's it.
i think the best way to describe my meta is fun competitive
like our decks are competitive, but we get bored of things personally that are not fun. so there are no narsets because that just plays the same way every time
so i think probe makes the cut, but thoughtseize probably doesnt

I still don't get the math on that though, because if you're really playing in a meta that competitive and tight you're simply spending resources to disable one dude's combo, weakening that player and yourself so the other two can go off
Since presumably everyone has the ability to win out of nowhere in a couple of turns
Great, so you Thoughsiezed away a combo piece from Player A. Player B and C still have theirs. Wouldn't you be better off just winning yourself?
im not sure i think it ends up that way
i think with partial paris that was true, but it’s too hard to combo off early these days
need some disruption
Sure, but you have to pick the right person to disrupt, and if everyone is really playing at that level seems like you've got a really good chance to pick the wrong one
Totally makes sense 1v1, I just don't see how it's effective more often than not in multi-player
i like krosan grip for example because i know who to disrupt. it’s better than something like probe or thoughtseize
That said it's not a game I play no wish to
Kgrip is different though, that's dealing with a threat in play that is in fact going to win
Presumably
right, but i don’t think thoughtseize and probe are that good and you are right. like nobody is going to play 5 thoughtseize effects
Though I suppose Sieze can be targeting the guy who just tutored, etc. I mean it's not like you're rolling a dice to see who to hi
hit
probe is different in that it replaces itself so its downside is negligible
what is the downside of probe
trinisphere is it
and the “lack of information” thing but thats negligible too
if those cards are in your meta I would definitely not play probe
I need a flow chart
lol
i think i mostly dont want to play probe because its not spicy
its pretty boring
its like 0: Draw a card
:kreygasm:
however i am excited now to play probe in mono black
and take advantage of my olorness as much as possible
im gonna test it and see. i’m thinking if there is a blue player sitting over there and he might have a counterspell and i’m about to exsanguinate for X=50… i might want to check
Probes downside is the opportunity cost of a better card
im not sure. it reduces you deck size to 98, increasing the chances of seeing 98 cards that are better than the 99th you just cut
we should have a youtube debate on gitaxian probe, who would of thought this would be an issue with so much to talk about haha
The conversation points to one of those key differences between the casual vs competitive crowds.
That's basically why Probe got the ax in modern and a restriction in Vintage. Playing a smaller deck is good.
The idea of playing essentially a 'bad' multiplayer card to thin your deck just doesn't enter into casual deck building.

It's not even really a bad card though. It's information gained for 2 life, but 2 life is rarely ever relevant in a format where multiple players have 40 life each on the dimension that it's 5% (and not 10%) of life totals as well as the high life encouraging big strats like Craterhoof and infinite tokens.

<@U4V5EHQ2G> re: Thoughtseize: It's not about math, it's about not losing. You thoughtseize away the Food Chain from the Prossh player that was going to go off on their turn, when you are one turn away yourself, and that lets you win the game. The fundamental flaw is thinking in terms of value. Value in cEDH isn't getting 2-for-1's, it's about (1) winning faster, and (2) making sure other people don't win faster.
That's a very cEDH way of looking at it, though. Part of the casual part is folks playing the game and not trying to get perfect information.
have you ever played with telepathy? that card is pretty fun

think why Force of Will is played as a 4-of in many legacy decks. It's a 1-for-2, but it's a tempo play that keeps you from losing. If you play blue legacy decks. Force of will actually feels really really bad to cast in legacy for the alt cost.
Telepathy is a fundamentally different card than Git Probe. Telepathy isn't free, it costs a card. Changes the calculus entirely.
yeah for sure, i’m just trying to point out that more information can be fun
it’s interactive

Right but I still felel like that it's ignoring the other two players. You stopped the Prossh food chain guy about to go off, but if it's really that level compative then it's it just as likely that the other two players are also gonna go off?
Telepathy is different because it affects more than one. That can be fun.
Wouldn't just going off yourself be way better?
<@U4V5EHQ2G> not necessarily. You need to use information on board states, cards in hand, behavior from last turn to figure out who is going to win fastest.
I'd rather have an answer than 'perfect' information about a single person.
<@U4V5EHQ2G> it is actually. But you can't go off if someone has a Mana Drain in hand for example.
<@U3L7A68JC> Git Probe means you don't need to make that choice. It's not "info vs answer," it's "info for free that draws into an answer"
:wink:
It's again a different of perspectives. Casuals want to play, competitives focus on winning.
uh oh
i think its time for me to cut this one off lol

I and the people I play with definitely take a different approach than most people to the format, for sure. I don't think it's entirely useless to more casual play, but sometimes it is. I'd never slot Thoughtseize into casual. But GitProbe is free; I put that in my casual blue deck. Mainly what caused me to respond to the whole discussion was a comment that someone wouldn't even consider it in cutthroat when Jeleva and Sidisi decks consider it all the time.
haha fair enough.
Still not getting it, but it's totally not my area. I'd rather get a ball kicking :slightly_smiling_face:
